result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerson A Morales was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: *Pay all costs, assessments and surcharges, submit DNA sample and pay costs and surcharges. Cash bail on deposit to apply and balance is due by 01/13/16 or a civil judgment shall be entered.
*Credit for 58 days time served. Huber to apply for work and work search. Defendant to report by noon on 09/17/15.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerson A Morales

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gerson A Morales in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AS to count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Count 2 is ordered dismissed and read in for sentencing.
Sentencing proceeded as to count 1.  Statements by parties.
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 100 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 58 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and work search.  Defendant to report by NOON on 9-17-2015.
Court orders defendant to pay all costs, assessments and surcharges, submit DNA sample and pay costs and surcharges.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY and balance is doe by 1-13-2016 or a civil judgment shall be entered.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Credit filed.

Defendant Gerson A Morales in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarra Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has posted bail and is being supervised by Justice Point.  Counsel is requesting that date for plea/sentencing remain.

15RM038824  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08/19/2015
Atty Dluzak is requesting that bail hearing be scheduled.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Gerson A Morales not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Gerson A Morales not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Due to branch 4 in trial and upon the request of defense counsel, case adjourned for Status Conferencein Branch 38 on 8-17-2015 at 8:15 am.   Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CASSANDRA M-R.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gerson A Morales in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Gerson A Morales in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
